p.s: The novel The Hate U Give by Angie Thomas had a very strong impact on my idea of everyday challenges of teenage life because I never heard a story like that before.
The storysstories that I usually hear are different because in Germany the injustice isn't that noticeable as in the USA.
It also helped me to open my eyes in case of everyday-racism which also happens a lot in Germany because I heard about the effects that it has on the victim.
I say something when I hear that someone says something racist even if it is only a joke.
Through the story I also got a much better perspective how racism is tolerated in other countries and how bad the injustice between black and white people still is.
It helped me to look through the eyes of a person who clearly is a victim of racism to really feel how racism is sadly a very dominant part of some people's lifeslives.
The novel also shows that in some parts of the world even the governementgovernment expeciallyespecially the police uses prejudices to justify their actions.
The Hate U Give showed me that most of the people are raised with prejudices.
Even Uncle Carlo who is a black person in the book, says that it makes a difference when a police officer meets a white person or a black person.
I think that this is totally wrong.
All in all the novel had a very big impact on my with the topic racism and teenage challenges.
I would suggest everybody to read this book so that maybe the eyes of other people can be opened to this topic.
